image.altText: Signage at an Optus store in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Embattled telco Optus has apologised for a network outage that led to nine failed triple-0 calls near Wollongong on the NSW south coast over the weekend.

title.children: Optus investigates more failed triple-0 calls in NSW outage

image.altText: Palm trees overhanging a beach and rocks jutting out of the water.

props.synopsis: The government has quietly extended a contract for the running of asylum seeker services on Nauru until 2027, taking the cost to $787 million. Follow live.

title.children: Government quietly extends Nauru contract, taking the cost to $787m

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lower payments, higher revenue from income and company tax credited for deficit shrink
PM 'crossed a line' with speech at UK Labour conference
Government to spend $787 million on Nauru contractor

image.altText: Kwar Ater, wearing a white shirt and smiling hugely.

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old was shot dead in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month, leaving his shocked family in search of answers.

title.children: 'Wanted to be part of something': 26yo killed as life was turning a corner

image.altText: A photo collage of Trump's silhouette framing a backdrop of offshore wind turbines

props.synopsis: US researchers have tracked how dark money funds a tangled web of climate denial think tanks with vested interests in slowing climate action. And Australia is not immune.

title.children: Trump-style 'climate hoax' playbook spreads to Australia

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a church fully engulfed in flame.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people were inside The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc Township when a 40-year-old man rammed his pick-up truck through the front door, then got out of the vehicle and started shooting.

title.children: Four dead after gunman opens fire in a Michigan Mormon church service

image.altText: A young girl jumping on a mattress on a red dirt ground.

props.synopsis: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity, as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for the climate of today, let alone into the future.

title.children: These Australians are homeless with a house

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding both hands above his head, waving to a crowd from a lectern.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and British counterpart Sir Keir Starmer embrace on stage in Liverpool, northern England, where rumours have been swirling about a leadership challenge to the UK PM.

title.children: PM hails UK–Australia relationship and vows to 'defend democracy itself'

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large Chinese ferry docking next to a landing barge. The barge has a pier extended from its front section.

props.synopsis: A classified US intelligence report, seen by the ABC, says vessels have been modified to carry tanks and partake in amphibious operations in what Taiwan considers part of China's "expansionist intentions".

title.children: China ferry fleet built amid Taiwan invasion preparations, classified report warns

image.altText: Paul Brereton speaks during inquiry.

props.synopsis: The head of the national anti-corruption commission told a Senate inquiry he had resigned his role at the defence force's investigative arm. But the ABC has learned he continued consulting for them, and documents proving his resignation could not be identified.

title.children: Anti-corruption chief kept consulting role after saying he had resigned

image.altText: Jordan Shanks, aka friendlyjordies, at his Bondi home

props.synopsis: Described as "a little boy in a very large body", the man who lit the blaze at the home of the YouTube comedian in 2022 apologised and said he would "rather die" than go back to jail.

title.children: Crime family associate jailed over firebombing of YouTube comic's home

image.altText: A view of an Antarctic ice sheet.

props.synopsis: A funding bid to establish a polar security research program has been knocked back, despite the changing geopolitical dynamics in Antarctica and the Southern Ocean.

title.children: Antarctic and Southern Ocean security in spotlight after failed funding bid

image.altText: Donald Trump and Pete Hegseth sit side by side in the white house.

props.synopsis: The US president said he will tell military leaders "we love them, they're cherished leaders" during a meeting organised by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.

title.children: Trump says he will tell US military leaders 'we love them' at mass gathering

image.altText: A man with tattoos on his chest and neck wears a baseball cap

props.synopsis: Three people face a Perth court accused of murdering 33-year-old Jayden Selfe, whose disappearance sparked an extensive investigation and led to the discovery of his body north of the city.

title.children: Police charge three people with murder after man's body found in bushland

image.altText: A man cheers during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Neither Melbourne nor Brisbane is approaching perfection ahead of their grand final showdown, but with what they've been through, neither team would want to.

title.children: The clash of furious styles that will define the 2025 NRL grand final

image.altText: Illustration of woman wearing Star of David necklace, wearing a green top and hand on chest

props.synopsis: Some members of Australia's Jewish community say they have experienced ongoing trauma and fear months after a video came to light that included threats to Israeli patients.

title.children: 'High level of distrust of medical staff': Trauma remains after nurses' video

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX bounced out of the blocks, supported by banks and healthcare stocks. Follow today's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX jumps after Wall Street ends losing streak

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A deeper dive into CSL vs US pharma tariffs — a less bitter pill
ASX 200 opens 0.9pc higher, boosted by banks and healthcare

image.altText: Back of woman in black top and jeans with long dark hair arms outstretched on stage in front of packed room hands in the air

props.synopsis: Astrid Jorgensen has an unusual condition — she finds many human noises unbearable. So how did she end up running the "world's biggest choir"?

title.children: How an email from reclusive star Kate Bush catapulted Astrid to world fame

image.altText: A man wearing a white suit and sunglasses smiles

props.synopsis: Grammy-winning rapper Bad Bunny is set to headline the Super Bowl half-time show in Northern California next year.

title.children: Latin superstar Bad Bunny to headline 2026 Super Bowl half-time show

image.altText: A close up of the word 'POLICE' on a white car

props.synopsis: SA Police say "time is of the essence" in their search for a four-year-old boy who has been missing from his family's homestead in South Australia's mid-north since Saturday evening.

title.children: Police still 'hopeful' in search for missing four-year-old boy in remote SA

image.altText: a woman holding hands with her partner as she leaves court.

props.synopsis: Melelani Crelley was handed 12 months' probation after pleading guilty to fraud and stealing charges.

title.children: Gold Coast nurse sentenced for stealing from coma patient

image.altText: mcilroy1

props.synopsis: A beer launched from the crowd almost hits Rory and Erica McIlroy after Europe dominated America in a tense Ryder Cup.

title.children: Ugly scenes mar Ryder Cup as beer almost hits McIlroy during Europe's win

image.altText: An outdoor sign pointing to a hospital's emergency department

props.synopsis: Queensland Health will investigate reports patients did not receive crucial test results from north Queensland's largest public hospital.

title.children: Cancer patients among those missing results in Qld hospital bungle

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: China is driving hard to supplant the US in this new military industrial complex, and has already achieved leadership in electric vehicles, batteries, drones and renewable energy.

title.children: Fusion-power deal heralds beginning of next great energy transition

image.altText: Three young boys sit behind a train set. The boy in the centre is looking at the camera while the others look at the train.

props.synopsis: It's been dubbed "the forgotten pandemic" — possibly because it coincided with some of the most momentous events in world history. But Dr John Gerrard argues variants of the H3N2 flu, which led to the Hong Kong flu pandemic, continue to cost lives.

title.children: The deadly legacy of the Hong Kong flu and its parallels to COVID-19

image.altText: Dawn light boat being towed behind another.

props.synopsis: Two men have been rescued with their catamaran after being adrift for two days following an engine failure off the northern NSW coast.

title.children: Missing sailors rescued after two days on 'poorly maintained' boat

image.altText: A man wearing a white shirt sits on a staircase next to a photo of a woman

props.synopsis: Eric Adams announces he is dropping his re-election bid, but says he will "continue to fight for this city" until his term ends on January 1, 2026.

title.children: New York City mayor drops re-election bid after unpopular tenure

image.altText: A woman is holding a a masked owl, wrapped in an orange towel while a man examines the owl's wing.

props.synopsis: If you're considering a career change, or want a taste of a new industry, volunteering can be a great option.

title.children: Changing careers can be scary but volunteering can make it easier

image.altText: A tank sitting in a field, firing an artillery round out of its front gun.

props.synopsis: The military wing of Hamas is calling for Israel to pull troops back and suspend air strikes for 24 hours so fighters can retrieve the captives.

title.children: Hamas loses contact with two hostages as Gaza offensive deepens

image.altText: Daniel Sanders slides through a corner in Portugal

props.synopsis: Daniel Sanders' world championship comes during a record-breaking run of form in the World Rally-Raid Championship.

title.children: Aussie Sanders secures world championship with another victory

image.altText: A reporter smiles next to a very large horned white cattle, with her hand on its back.

props.synopsis: Ann Cochram's eyes light up when she talks about the "magical" cattle she breeds, which can weigh as much as a small car.

title.children: 'Majestic' cattle too large for some butchers to process, farmer says

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. His family feel their pleas for licence reforms have been ignored by the state government.

title.children: Grieving family's anger at lack of licence reform amidst government 'buck-passing'

image.altText: A fishing boat lilts in dirty, rough water as rescuers hold ropes.

props.synopsis: As Typhoon Bualoi approaches Vietnam, thousands of people are seeking safer ground.

title.children: Typhoon Bualoi forces thousands to evacuate in Vietnam

image.altText: image of tiny home on wheels.

props.synopsis: Shellharbour Council approves a plan for a tiny homes planning pathway which it says could be adopted statewide, as owners face uncertainty around legal installation.

title.children: 'Easy way forward' for tiny homes as NSW-first pilot gets greenlight
